choices: open grassland which they can run across
densely wooded areas to breed in
areas which include a range of plants
land that has been farmed intensively for years

question: According to the writer, what is the ideal habitat for hares?

text: Like many herbivores, brown hares spend a relatively large amount of their time feeding. They prefer to do this in the dark, but when nights are short, their activities do spill into daylight hours. Wherever they live, hares appear to have a fondness for fields with a variety of vegetation, for example short as well as longer clumps of grasses. Studies have demonstrated that they benefit from uncultivated land and other unploughed areas on farms, such as field margins.
